meanings.sent1: After playing outside all day, I felt completely magged.
meanings.sent2: She magged after running the marathon.
meanings.sent3: I was so magged after studying for hours that I fell asleep at my desk.
meanings.sent4: The long hike magged me more than I expected.
meanings.sent5: The intense workout session left me magged for the rest of the day.

meanings.sent1: The persistent sales calls magged her throughout the day.
meanings.sent2: He felt magged by his little brother's constant questions.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing mosquito magged me all night long.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending emails magged her attention away from work.
meanings.sent5: The noisy neighbors magged him with their loud music every night.

meanings.definition: To be dressed in a showy or flashy manner.
meanings.sent1: She magged up in a sparkly dress for the party.
meanings.sent2: The performer magged in a colorful costume for the show.
meanings.sent3: He decided to mag up in a bright suit for the event.
meanings.sent4: The actress magged herself in elegant jewelry for the red carpet.
meanings.sent5: The peacock magged in its vibrant feathers to attract a mate.
